Defendant associated with a white Malibu sedan and charged with transporting undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: White Malibu sedan associated with RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR., stopped by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino near Farm-to-Market Road 2050, transporting undocumented aliens, including five passengers and two in the trunk, driven on a road primarily used by local residents and oil company employees, registered to Hertz Rental Car Company
Defendant who waived his rights and provided a timeline of events, but changed details of his story several times during the interview
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: Black Dodge pickup truck recognized by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino as not belonging to a local resident, stopped at the Freer Immigration Checkpoint, traveling in tandem with RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle and IGN: Vehicles involved in the incident, including a white Malibu sedan and a black Dodge pickup truck, stopped near the Border Patrol Station Parking Lot, attempting to avoid the Hebbronville Checkpoint, within fifty miles of the Mexico border, with out-of-town registrations, traveling in tandem on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
